freeRecall

Class Session

  • java.lang.Object
    • freeRecall.Session
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    extendedSession

    public class Session
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for running session simulation - a series of trials with a common similarity matrix. In order to run session one need to create a Session with a specific number of words in a pool using Session(int). Then set number of words in a study list using setListSize(int).Set up the parameters of the stat field. Set the object that will perform single trial simulation using setTrialSim(freeRecall.Trial). Set the similarity matrix for your model using setSimilarityMatrix(double[][]) or setSimilarityMatrix(int[][]). Then you are ready to run simulation using computeSession(int). All fields made public to have access from MATLAB(C).

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int listSize 
      int numWords 
      double[][] similarityMatrix 
      Stat stat
      This object collects the statistics collected during the trials in the session
      double[][] transitionMatrix 
      Trial trialSim
      The object that will perform the real single trial simulations
      int[] wordList
      The words selected for the current trial

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void computeSession(int nTrials)
      Each trial listSize items are selected from the pool at random and trialSim is asked to perform a single trial simulation

      void prepareTransitionMatrix()
      Selects similarity sub-matrix corresponding to selected words in a list

      allows to set external sources the similarity matrix

        public void setListSize(int listSize)

      • computeSession

        public void computeSession(int nTrials)
        Each trial listSize items are selected from the pool at random and trialSim is asked to perform a single trial simulation
        Parameters:
        nTrials - - number of trials to run

      • firstRecalledWord

        public int firstRecalledWord()
        In the current implementation this method returns last word in a list. Given that there is no serial effects it does not matter from which word recall is started.
        Returns:
        the word that should be recalled first

      • prepareTransitionMatrix

        public void prepareTransitionMatrix()
        Selects similarity sub-matrix corresponding to selected words in a list

        public void setSimilarityMatrix(double[][] similarityMatrix)
        allows to set external sources the similarity matrix
        Parameters:
        similarityMatrix - square similarity matrix of size numWords set in the constructor
